title: [Health] A surge in tea consumption in 18th century England unintentionally caused a substantial decline in mortality. The English consumed more boiled water, reducing their vulnerability to waterborne diseases.

[Neuroscience] Minor everyday rises in blood pressure due to short-term stressors can be linked to a brain area that controls conscious and learned motor skills. This discovery paves the way for a chance to influence the rises in blood pressure and, in the long run, prevent hypertension.
